job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY
pros: Lots to learn, many opportunities for growth.
cons: Long hours, management (senior) tone death to what’s really going on

review_title: Some of the staff are very kindly spirited to work for the patients needs.
job_title: Non Medical, Skilled in New York, NY
pros: A large facility with lots of nice people including some bosses and union workers.
cons: A lot of work for one person, due to cut backs. Some bosses and administration are not respectful towards staff, phoney.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: i get a paycheck. Easy commute. Nice view of the park.
cons: Where to begin, building is 100 years old, it smells like sewage, paint on walls in my office is cracked and the dust and led are making me sick.  Management could care less about anything. There is zero respect. Workload is way too heavy and pay is way too low. No guidance. You're pretty much on your own. Good luck trying to remain sane.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in New York, NY
pros: 1199 Benefits. Flexible hours. A great learning experience for new grads. Multiple units respiratory, dialysis, etc.
cons: Horrible management favoritism and unprofessional. Horrible Co-workers and they try to set you up. Many of the patients are ex-convicts, and drug dealers and nurses are not protected from them. Unsafe environment. Revolving door.
